alert.note: Alert for Bonner; Kootenai (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 21 at 2:50PM MST until February 21 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Bonner County in the Panhandle of Idaho... Northwestern Kootenai County in the Panhandle of Idaho... * Until 245 PM PST. * At 149 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Newport to 6 miles southeast of Athol, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 439 and 461. U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 1 and 14. Locations impacted include... Priest River, Spirit Lake, Athol, Oldtown, Chilco, Laclede, Bayview, Careywood and Blanchard. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
